p: Here we report the results of a field experiment in which we independently manipulated temperature and reproductive phenology, specifically, timing of seed release. We focus on musk thistle ( Carduus nutans L.), a widespread invasive species that advances flowering in response to warming (Zhang et al. 2012). Musk thistle is a monocarpic perennial with size‚Äêdependent reproduction. Changes in growth are therefore expected to directly affect the musk thistle life cycle and hence its demography.
